3/* thr_posix.c - wrapper around posix and posixish thread implementations. */

19#include <sys/cdefs.h>
20__RCSID("$NetBSD: thr_posix.c,v 1.1.1.6 2018/02/06 01:53:08 christos Exp $");
21
22#include "portable.h"
23
24#if defined( HAVE_PTHREADS )
25
26#include <ac/errno.h>
27
28#ifdef REPLACE_BROKEN_YIELD
29#ifndef HAVE_NANOSLEEP
30#include <ac/socket.h>
31#endif
32#include <ac/time.h>
33#endif
34
35#include "ldap_pvt_thread.h" /* Get the thread interface */
36#define LDAP_THREAD_IMPLEMENTATION
37#define LDAP_THREAD_RDWR_IMPLEMENTATION
38#include "ldap_thr_debug.h" /* May rename the symbols defined below */
39#include <signal.h> /* For pthread_kill() */
40
41#if HAVE_PTHREADS < 6
42# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_ATTR_DEFAULT pthread_attr_default
43# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_CONDATTR_DEFAULT pthread_condattr_default
44# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR_DEFAULT pthread_mutexattr_default
45#else
46# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_ATTR_DEFAULT NULL
47# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_CONDATTR_DEFAULT NULL
48# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR_DEFAULT NULL
49#endif
50
51#ifdef LDAP_THREAD_DEBUG
52# if defined LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR /* May be defined in CPPFLAGS */
53# elif defined HAVE_PTHREAD_KILL_OTHER_THREADS_NP
54 /* LinuxThreads hack */
55# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR PTHREAD_MUTEX_ERRORCHECK_NP
56# else
57# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR PTHREAD_MUTEX_ERRORCHECK
58# endif
59static pthread_mutexattr_t mutex_attr;
60# undef LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR_DEFAULT
61# define LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR_DEFAULT &mutex_attr
62#endif
63
64#if HAVE_PTHREADS < 7
65#define ERRVAL(val) ((val) < 0 ? errno : 0)
66#else
67#define ERRVAL(val) (val)
68#endif
69
70int
71ldap_int_thread_initialize( void )
72{
73#ifdef LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR
74 pthread_mutexattr_init( &mutex_attr );
75 pthread_mutexattr_settype( &mutex_attr, LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR );
76#endif
77 return 0;
78}
79
80int
81ldap_int_thread_destroy( void )
82{
83#ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_KILL_OTHER_THREADS_NP
84 /* LinuxThreads: kill clones */
85 pthread_kill_other_threads_np();
86#endif
87#ifdef LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR
88 pthread_mutexattr_destroy( &mutex_attr );
89#endif
90 return 0;
91}
92
93#ifdef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_SETCONCURRENCY
94int
95ldap_pvt_thread_set_concurrency(int n)
96{
97#ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_SETCONCURRENCY
98 return pthread_setconcurrency( n );
99#elif defined(HAVE_THR_SETCONCURRENCY)
100 return thr_setconcurrency( n );
101#else
102 return 0;
103#endif
104}
105#endif
106
107#ifdef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_GETCONCURRENCY
108int
109ldap_pvt_thread_get_concurrency(void)
110{
111#ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_GETCONCURRENCY
112 return pthread_getconcurrency();
113#elif defined(HAVE_THR_GETCONCURRENCY)
114 return thr_getconcurrency();
115#else
116 return 0;
117#endif
118}
119#endif
120
121/* detachstate appeared in Draft 6, but without manifest constants.
122 * in Draft 7 they were called PTHREAD_CREATE_UNDETACHED and ...DETACHED.
123 * in Draft 8 on, ...UNDETACHED became ...JOINABLE.
124 */
125#ifndef PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE
126#ifdef PTHREAD_CREATE_UNDETACHED
127#define PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE PTHREAD_CREATE_UNDETACHED
128#else
129#define PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE 0
130#endif
131#endif
132
133#ifndef PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED
134#define PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED 1
135#endif
136
137int
138ldap_pvt_thread_create( ldap_pvt_thread_t * thread,
139 int detach,
140 void *(*start_routine)( void * ),
141 void *arg)
142{
143 int rtn;
144 pthread_attr_t attr;
145
146/* Always create the thread attrs, so we can set stacksize if we need to */
147#if HAVE_PTHREADS > 5
148 pthread_attr_init(&attr);
149#else
150 pthread_attr_create(&attr);
151#endif
152
153#ifdef LDAP_PVT_THREAD_SET_STACK_SIZE
154 /* this should be tunable */
155 pthread_attr_setstacksize( &attr, LDAP_PVT_THREAD_STACK_SIZE );
156#endif
157
158#if HAVE_PTHREADS > 5
159 detach = detach ? PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED : PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE;
160#if HAVE_PTHREADS == 6
161 pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, &detach);
162#else
163 pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, detach);
164#endif
165#endif
166
167#if HAVE_PTHREADS < 5
168 rtn = pthread_create( thread, attr, start_routine, arg );
169#else
170 rtn = pthread_create( thread, &attr, start_routine, arg );
171#endif
172
173#if HAVE_PTHREADS > 5
174 pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
175#else
176 pthread_attr_delete(&attr);
177 if( detach ) {
178 pthread_detach( thread );
179 }
180#endif
181
182#if HAVE_PTHREADS < 7
183 if ( rtn < 0 ) rtn = errno;
184#endif
185 return rtn;
186}
187
188void
189ldap_pvt_thread_exit( void *retval )
190{
191 pthread_exit( retval );
192}
193
194int
195ldap_pvt_thread_join( ldap_pvt_thread_t thread, void **thread_return )
196{
197#if HAVE_PTHREADS < 7
198 void *dummy;
199 if (thread_return==NULL)
200 thread_return=&dummy;
201#endif
202 return ERRVAL( pthread_join( thread, thread_return ) );
203}
204
205int
206ldap_pvt_thread_kill( ldap_pvt_thread_t thread, int signo )
207{
208#if defined(HAVE_PTHREAD_KILL) && HAVE_PTHREADS > 4
209 /* MacOS 10.1 is detected as v10 but has no pthread_kill() */
210 return ERRVAL( pthread_kill( thread, signo ) );
211#else
212 /* pthread package with DCE */
213 if (kill( getpid(), signo )<0)
214 return errno;
215 return 0;
216#endif
217}
218
219int
220ldap_pvt_thread_yield( void )
221{
222#ifdef REPLACE_BROKEN_YIELD
223#ifdef HAVE_NANOSLEEP
224 struct timespec t = { 0, 0 };
225 nanosleep(&t, NULL);
226#else
227 struct timeval tv = {0,0};
228 select( 0, NULL, NULL, NULL, &tv );
229#endif
230 return 0;
231
232#elif defined(HAVE_THR_YIELD)
233 thr_yield();
234 return 0;
235
236#elif HAVE_PTHREADS == 10
237 return sched_yield();
238
239#elif defined(_POSIX_THREAD_IS_GNU_PTH)
240 sched_yield();
241 return 0;
242
243#elif HAVE_PTHREADS == 6
244 pthread_yield(NULL);
245 return 0;
246
247#else
248 pthread_yield();
249 return 0;
250#endif
251}
252
253int
254ldap_pvt_thread_cond_init( ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t *cond )
255{
256 return ERRVAL( pthread_cond_init(
257 cond, LDAP_INT_THREAD_CONDATTR_DEFAULT ) );
258}
259
260int
261ldap_pvt_thread_cond_destroy( ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t *cond )
262{
263 return ERRVAL( pthread_cond_destroy( cond ) );
264}
265
266int
267ldap_pvt_thread_cond_signal( ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t *cond )
268{
269 return ERRVAL( pthread_cond_signal( cond ) );
270}
271
272int
273ldap_pvt_thread_cond_broadcast( ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t *cond )
274{
275 return ERRVAL( pthread_cond_broadcast( cond ) );
276}
277
278int
279ldap_pvt_thread_cond_wait( ldap_pvt_thread_cond_t *cond,
280 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
281{
282 return ERRVAL( pthread_cond_wait( cond, mutex ) );
283}
284
285int
286ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
287{
288 return ERRVAL( pthread_mutex_init(
289 mutex, LDAP_INT_THREAD_MUTEXATTR_DEFAULT ) );
290}
291
292int
293ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
294{
295 return ERRVAL( pthread_mutex_destroy( mutex ) );
296}
297
298int
299ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_lock( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
300{
301 return ERRVAL( pthread_mutex_lock( mutex ) );
302}
303
304int
305ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_trylock( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
306{
307 return ERRVAL( pthread_mutex_trylock( mutex ) );
308}
309
310int
311ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_unlock( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t *mutex )
312{
313 return ERRVAL( pthread_mutex_unlock( mutex ) );
314}
315
316ldap_pvt_thread_t ldap_pvt_thread_self( void )
317{
318 return pthread_self();
319}
320
321int
322ldap_pvt_thread_key_create( ldap_pvt_thread_key_t *key )
323{
324 return pthread_key_create( key, NULL );
325}
326
327int
328ldap_pvt_thread_key_destroy( ldap_pvt_thread_key_t key )
329{
330 return pthread_key_delete( key );
331}
332
333int
334ldap_pvt_thread_key_setdata( ldap_pvt_thread_key_t key, void *data )
335{
336 return pthread_setspecific( key, data );
337}
338
339int
340ldap_pvt_thread_key_getdata( ldap_pvt_thread_key_t key, void **data )
341{
342 *data = pthread_getspecific( key );
343 return 0;
344}

346#ifdef LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_RDWR
347#ifdef HAVE_PTHREAD_RWLOCK_DESTROY
348int
349ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_init( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
350{
351 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_init( rw, NULL ) );
352}
353
354int
355ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_destroy( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
356{
357 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_destroy( rw ) );
358}
359
360int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_rlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
361{
362 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_rdlock( rw ) );
363}
364
365int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_rtrylock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
366{
367 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_tryrdlock( rw ) );
368}
369
370int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_runlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
371{
372 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_unlock( rw ) );
373}
374
375int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
376{
377 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_wrlock( rw ) );
378}
379
380int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wtrylock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
381{
382 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_trywrlock( rw ) );
383}
384
385int ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_wunlock( ldap_pvt_thread_rdwr_t *rw )
386{
387 return ERRVAL( pthread_rwlock_unlock( rw ) );
388}
389
390#endif /* HAVE_PTHREAD_RWLOCK_DESTROY */
391#endif /* LDAP_THREAD_HAVE_RDWR */
392#endif /* HAVE_PTHREADS */
